etymologies: mid 19th century: originally a shot at an animal intended for the pot, i.e. purely for food, rather than for display (which would require skilled shooting according to hunting rules)

definitions: a shot aimed unexpectedly or at random at someone or something with no chance of self-defense

examples.text: a sniper took a potshot at him

shortDefinitions: shot aimed at person or thing that happens to be within easy reach

definitions: a criticism, especially a random or unfounded one

examples.text: the show takes wickedly funny potshots at movies

definitions: a shot at a game bird or other animal purely to kill it for food, without regard to the rules of the sport.
shortDefinitions: shot at game bird or other animal purely to kill it for food, without regard to rules
